info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 12:28AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Perry, southern Jefferson, northern Williamson, northeastern Jackson and Franklin Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1228 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tamaroa to near Du Quoin to near De Soto. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Christopher, Sesser and Valier around 1235 AM CDT. Herrin, Benton, Rend Lake Area, Zeigler and West City around 1240 AM CDT. West Frankfort and Johnston City around 1245 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Thompsonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 59 and 88. Interstate 64 in Illinois between Mile Markers 89 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
